medical_history.chief_complaint: Unilateral upper extremity edema and arm nodules.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first noticed intermittent right upper extremity swelling 1Â½ years before presentation while playing golf. The swelling became persistent after 6 months, after which he developed multiple red papules and ulcers on the extremity.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Had a primary BCC on mid-back that was completely excised 8 years previously, which had perineural invasion and was 3.0 cm in diameter.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother and father had had BCCs.
